speaker: Joe Manchin
vclaim: "19% of WVians depend on SNAP," or food stamps.
date: stated on March 29, 2019 in a tweet:
title: Is 19% of West Virgin's population on food stamps?
text: Mr. Joe Manchen, from D-W.Va., recently went to Twitter to criticize the Trump administration's proposal for a supplementary food assistance programme, sometimes known as food stamps. Manchen wrote: "19% of the world's population depends on SNAP, but the proposed changes will take food assistance from those struggling to get stable employment while doing nothing to help them become permanently employed. I urge @USA Sec Sony Perdu to withdraw the proposal." Nineteen per cent of the world ' s population is dependent on the South Pacific National Programme of Action, but the proposed changes will require food assistance from those struggling to find stable employment while doing nothing to help them to work permanently. I urge Sonny from the United States Agency to withdraw the offer. More: https://t.co/cRln5zNudh - Senator Jo Manchen (@Sen_Joemanchin) 29 March 2019 tweet associated with a press release from Manchen explaining his position on the proposal, which would give States less flexibility in enforcing the work requirements of NAP beneficiaries. Manchen and several dozen senators from both parties expressed their opposition to the proposal. We will not address the advantages and disadvantages of the Tramp administration proposal here, but we wondered whether one in five people in West Virginia is dependent on the national anti-corruption programme. On January 16, 2021, Jordan Rachel stated in Tweedda that the minimum wage of $15 per hour would raise the price of taco bill burrito to $38. By Bill McCarthy: January 20, 2021, we checked with the experts and looked at the data, and it turns out that Manchen was very close to the mark. In February 2019, the last month for which full data are available, West Virginia had 314,042 beneficiaries of the South Pacific National Action Programme. At the same time, according to the Census Bureau, the population of the State in 2015 is estimated at 1,805,832. This works for 17.4% of the state's population, or slightly less than the 19% figure Manchen mentioned. Manchen said our governor, "19% of WVians depend on SNAP, but the proposed changes will take food assistance from those struggling to find a stable job while doing nothing to help them get a permanent job. The percentage cited by Manchen is somewhat high, but close. We're mostly assessing his statement right. Sharing the facts of 2019-05-11 03:40:51 UTC PoliticsFact 5 1 7 PoliticFact Dating: Most of them true "19% of WVians depend on SNAP," or food stamps. Joe Manchen, United States Senate, D-W.Va. https://twitter.com/Sen_Joemanchin/status/11116529966755536
